title: Cellulite
contentEn:
(Lumpy Fat)
SYMPTOMS—Lumpy pockets of fat on the thighs, insides of upper arms, and gluteus maximus.
CAUSES—With the passing of years, strands of fibrous tissue anchor to the skin. As they do this, they
pull the skin inward. This causes fat cells to push upward. Women especially tend to have this problem
in the buttocks, hips, and thighs.
There is no known cure, but there are suggestions you may wish to try:
TREATMENT—Lose weight. This will help reduce the protruding pockets of fat.
• Eat plenty of fresh fruits and vegetables. These are both nourishing and lower in calories.
Improve your general pattern of diet and take vitamin/mineral supplements.
• Keep the channels of elimination open, so excess fluids and fat can be more easily
eliminated. Only use a very small amount of salt, drink plenty of water, keep the bowels
open, maintain regularity, and avoid constipation.
• Do not use caffeine or tobacco. Both constrict your blood vessels and make the cellulite
more prominent.
• Do muscle-toning exercises.
• Make sure you are obtaining adequate rest.
• Exercise out-of-doors and breathe deeply. The oxygen helps burn fat; and the better
ventilation helps empty carbon dioxide from body cells.
• To whatever degree you can, avoid stress, tension, and time schedules. Cellulite builds
up when muscles become tense, and muscles tense when you are agitated.
contentSw:
(Mafuta ya Lumpy)
Dalili -Mifuko ya mafuta kwenye mapaja, ndani ya mikono ya juu, na gluteus maximus.
Sababu -na kupita kwa miaka, kamba ya nanga ya tishu zenye nyuzi kwenye ngozi. Wanapofanya hivi, wao
Bonyeza ngozi ndani. Hii husababisha seli za mafuta kushinikiza juu. Wanawake haswa huwa na shida hii
Katika matako, viuno, na mapaja.
Hakuna tiba inayojulikana, lakini kuna maoni ambayo unaweza kutaka kujaribu:
Matibabu -Uzito wa Lose. Hii itasaidia kupunguza mifuko ya mafuta.
• Kula matunda na mboga nyingi safi. Hizi zote zinalisha na chini katika kalori.
Boresha muundo wako wa jumla wa lishe na uchukue virutubisho vya vitamini/madini.
• Weka vituo vya kuondoa wazi, kwa hivyo maji mengi na mafuta yanaweza kuwa kwa urahisi zaidi
kuondolewa. Tumia tu kiasi kidogo cha chumvi, kunywa maji mengi, weka matumbo
Fungua, kudumisha utaratibu, na epuka kuvimbiwa.
• Usitumie kafeini au tumbaku. Zote mbili hutengeneza mishipa yako ya damu na kutengeneza cellulite
maarufu zaidi.
• Fanya mazoezi ya misuli.
• Hakikisha unapata kupumzika kwa kutosha.
• Zoezi nje ya milango na kupumua kwa undani. Oksijeni husaidia kuchoma mafuta; Na bora
Uingizaji hewa husaidia dioksidi kaboni kutoka kwa seli za mwili.
• Kwa kiwango chochote unachoweza, epuka mafadhaiko, mvutano, na ratiba za wakati. Cellulite huunda
juu wakati misuli inakuwa wakati, na misuli wakati unakasirika.

title: Urine Problems
contentEn:
HYDRO—Here are hydrotherapy treatments for several different urine difficulties. This brief summary
is taken from the author's book, Water Therapy Manual (see order sheet), which will provide many
more details on how to give the treatments:
Albumin in urine (Albuminuria): Hot Blanket Pack and other sweating measures to maintain cutaneous
activity, repeated every 2-4 hours (p. 233).
Incontinence: Percussion Douche to spine, Neutral Sitz Bath, 15-30 minutes (p. 209).
Urine too acid: Free use of fruit and water drinking in the forenoon (p 249).
Urinary suppression: Hot Blanket Pack, followed by Dry Sweating Pack (p. 215).
Nocturia: Revulsive Sitz Bath. Begin at 100o and increase rapidly to 106o-115o F. (with a footbath at
110o-112o F.) for 3-8 minutes. Keep the head cool with cold cloths over forehead or around back of
neck. Finish with a cold (55o-65o F.) pail pour to hips (p. 120).
contentSw:
Hydro - Hapa kuna matibabu ya hydrotherapy kwa shida kadhaa tofauti za mkojo. Muhtasari huu mfupi
inachukuliwa kutoka kwa kitabu cha mwandishi, Mwongozo wa Tiba ya Maji (tazama Karatasi ya Agizo), ambayo itatoa nyingi
Maelezo zaidi juu ya jinsi ya kutoa matibabu:
Albin in mkojo (albinuria): pakiti ya blanketi moto na hatua zingine za jasho ili kudumisha cutaneous
shughuli, kurudiwa kila masaa 2-4 (uk. 233).
Kukosekana: Dhana ya Percussion kwa mgongo, umwagaji wa Sitz, dakika 15-30 (uk. 209).
Mkojo pia asidi: Matumizi ya bure ya matunda na kunywa maji mbele (p 249).
Kukandamiza mkojo: Ufungashaji wa blanketi moto, ikifuatiwa na pakiti kavu ya jasho (uk. 215).
Nocturia: Bafu ya Sitz inayobadilika. Anza saa 100o na uongeze haraka hadi 106o-115o F. (na mguu wa miguu saa
110O-112O F.) kwa dakika 3-8. Weka kichwa baridi na vitambaa baridi juu ya paji la uso au nyuma ya
shingo. Maliza na baridi (55o-65o F.) Pail tor kwa viuno (uk. 120).

title: Urine Retention
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Poor urine flow: Take a cold sitz bath (cold partial bath, as you sit in the bathtub). Stop
using salt. Drink 2 quarts a day of 50-50 orange juice and water.
• Alternate method: Take a hot sitz bath repeatedly, followed by a short cold bath. If
bedridden, apply hot, followed by short cold, over bladder, genital area, and entire length
of spine.
• Give a high enema of catnip tea. This is important in helping the urine to again begin
flowing.
• Drink more water and take herbs which increase urine flow. Corn-silk tea is the best;
others include juniper berries, carrot tops, comfrey, plantain, cleavers, chickweed.
• Insert a soft catheter and draw out the urine. Steep the following in a quart of boiling
water: 1 tsp. goldenseal and a half tsp. each of boric acid and myrrh. Strain through a fine
cloth, and inject through a fountain syringe. Retain as long as possible. You can moisten
the tip with slippery elm tea. Slipper elm is slippery!
• A cold shower often helps.
• Stopped urine flow: Almost total urine suppression generally points to the kidneys as the
problem.
• Put the person to bed; give him a very warm high enema of catnip tea. This will bring
great relief. Also apply hot fomentations, wrung out of smartweed tea, to the bladder and
lumbar region (small of back). Give 2-3 hot sitz baths in a bathtub, each day.
• An especially helpful remedy is a strong, hot as can be taken, tea of catnip, given as an
enema. Drink it freely.
—Also see the kidney and bladder diseases in this Urinary section.
SYMPTOMS—Flow of urine is lessening. Great pain is felt in the bladder, and the odor of urine is on
the body. Almost total suppression can produce extreme pain in the back and bladder, and even
convulsions. There is always a great desire to urinate.
CAUSES—There can be a blockage of some type. See Kidney Problems, Bladder Problems, and other
topics in this Urinary section.
Urine retention is generally caused by inflammation and swelling in the bladder and its outlet. Excess
urine in it causes the bladder to enlarge, and can cause great pain.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Mtiririko duni wa mkojo: Chukua bafu baridi ya sitz (umwagaji baridi wa sehemu, unapokaa kwenye bafu). Acha
Kutumia chumvi. Kunywa quarts 2 kwa siku ya juisi ya machungwa 50-50 na maji.
Njia mbadala: Chukua bafu ya moto ya Sitz mara kwa mara, ikifuatiwa na umwagaji mfupi wa baridi. Ikiwa
Bedrid, tumia moto, ikifuatiwa na baridi fupi, juu ya kibofu cha mkojo, eneo la sehemu ya siri, na urefu mzima
ya mgongo.
• Toa enema ya juu ya chai ya catnip. Hii ni muhimu katika kusaidia mkojo kuanza tena
inapita.
• Kunywa maji zaidi na uchukue mimea ambayo huongeza mtiririko wa mkojo. Chai ya kunyoosha-mahindi ndio bora zaidi;
Wengine ni pamoja na matunda ya juniper, vilele vya karoti, comfrey, mmea, cleavers, vifaranga.
• Ingiza catheter laini na chora mkojo. Mwinuko wafuatayo katika lita moja ya kuchemsha
Maji: 1 tsp. Goldenseal na nusu tsp. Kila moja ya asidi ya boric na manemane. Shika kwa faini
kitambaa, na sindano kupitia sindano ya chemchemi. Kudumisha muda mrefu iwezekanavyo. Unaweza unyevu
Ncha na chai ya Elm ya kuteleza. Slipper Elm ni ya kuteleza!
• Kuoga baridi mara nyingi husaidia.
• Mtiririko wa mkojo uliosimamishwa: Karibu jumla ya kukandamiza mkojo kwa ujumla huelekeza figo kama
Tatizo.
• Weka mtu kitandani; Mpe enema ya joto sana ya chai ya Catnip. Hii italeta
unafuu mkubwa. Tumia pia fomentations moto, kutoka kwa chai ya smartweed, kwa kibofu cha mkojo na
Mkoa wa lumbar (ndogo ya nyuma). Toa bafu 2-3 za moto kwenye bafu, kila siku.
• Suluhisho linalosaidia sana ni nguvu, moto kama inavyoweza kuchukuliwa, chai ya catnip, iliyopewa kama
Enema. Kunywa kwa uhuru.
-Unaona magonjwa ya figo na kibofu cha mkojo katika sehemu hii ya mkojo.
Dalili -mtiririko wa mkojo unapungua. Ma maumivu makubwa huhisi katika kibofu cha mkojo, na harufu ya mkojo imewashwa
mwili. Karibu kukandamiza jumla kunaweza kutoa maumivu makali nyuma na kibofu cha mkojo, na hata
Confulsions. Daima kuna hamu kubwa ya kukojoa.
Sababu - kunaweza kuwa na blockage ya aina fulani. Tazama shida za figo, shida za kibofu cha mkojo, na zingine
Mada katika sehemu hii ya mkojo.
Uhifadhi wa mkojo kwa ujumla husababishwa na uchochezi na uvimbe katika kibofu cha mkojo na njia yake. Ziada
Mkojo ndani yake husababisha kibofu cha mkojo kupanuka, na inaweza kusababisha maumivu makubwa.

title: Hematuria
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Apply a very cold water spray to the perineum.
• Read the other sections, below, in this urinary section, on urine, kidneys, and bladder.
(Blood in Urine)
SYMPTOMS—Blood appears in the urine. Blood in the urine shows a smoky sediment, and is reddish
brown. Urine may be slightly smoky, reddish, or very red.
CAUSES—Red, or reddish, urine may be due to blood in the urine, known as hematuria, and to senna or
rhubarb, which may color the urine either brown or orange.
If the blood is well-mixed with the urine, it is probably from the kidneys. If it is clotted in tubular casts
of ureters, it is from kidneys or ureters. If its is passed at the beginning of urination, it is from the
urethra; if at the end, it is from the bladder.
Bleeding from the kidneys produces smoky urine, which may be bright red. Bleeding from the urethra is
always bright red, and precedes urination. Bleeding from the urine vesicle produces bright red urine,
which is not uniform.
Other causes of blood in urine can be a lesion of the urinary tract, contamination during menstruation,
prostatic disease, tumors, poisoning (especially carbolic acid and cantharides), malaria, toxemias, and
calculus (kidney stones).
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Omba dawa ya maji baridi sana kwa perineum.
• Soma sehemu zingine, hapa chini, katika sehemu hii ya mkojo, kwenye mkojo, figo, na kibofu cha mkojo.
(Damu kwenye mkojo)
Dalili -Damu huonekana kwenye mkojo. Damu kwenye mkojo inaonyesha sediment ya moshi, na ni nyekundu
kahawia. Mkojo unaweza kuwa wa kuvuta sigara kidogo, nyekundu, au nyekundu sana.
Sababu - nyekundu, au nyekundu, mkojo unaweza kuwa ni kwa sababu ya damu kwenye mkojo, unaojulikana kama hematuria, na kwa senna au
rhubarb, ambayo inaweza rangi mkojo ama kahawia au machungwa.
Ikiwa damu imechanganywa vizuri na mkojo, labda ni kutoka kwa figo. Ikiwa imefungwa kwenye saruji za tubular
ya ureters, ni kutoka kwa figo au ureters. Ikiwa imepitishwa mwanzoni mwa mkojo, ni kutoka kwa
urethra; Ikiwa mwisho, ni kutoka kwa kibofu cha mkojo.
Kutokwa na damu kutoka kwa figo hutoa mkojo wa moshi, ambao unaweza kuwa nyekundu nyekundu. Kutokwa na damu kutoka kwa urethra ni
Daima nyekundu nyekundu, na hutangulia mkojo. Kutokwa na damu kutoka kwa mkojo wa mkojo hutoa mkojo nyekundu nyekundu,
ambayo sio sare.
Sababu zingine za damu kwenye mkojo zinaweza kuwa kidonda cha njia ya mkojo, uchafu wakati wa hedhi,
Ugonjwa wa kibofu, tumors, sumu (haswa asidi ya carbolic na cantharides), ugonjwa wa mala, toxemias, na
Calculator (Mawe ya figo).

title: Bright'S Disease
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• See your physician.
• Take a high enema and a daily hot half-hour tub bath. Give 2-3 cups of pleurisy tea or
sage tea while in the tub. Finish with a short cold shower or cold towel rub. Do not let him
chill. Wrap him up well, put him in bed, and give him more pleurisy tea or sage tea to
encourage perspiration. Fomentations over the lower back and the entire length of the
spine will help alleviate pain. Do this also over the stomach, liver, and spleen.
• For other natural remedies which can help control urinary tract infection, see under
"Nephritis" and "Cystitis."
SYMPTOMS—Fever, chills, urgency and frequency of urination, loss of appetite, nausea, and
vomiting. The urine is cloudy from pus, and often bloody. Pain may be intense and sudden in the lower
back, just above the waist, and running down the groin. An excessive amount of blood protein in the
urine is a marked symptom of Bright's disease. It is usually accompanied by hypertension and edema,
which is retention of water in the tissues.
CAUSES—Bright's disease involves a chronic inflammation of the kidneys (nephritis; which see), but it
is unique in the following respect: The kidneys cannot properly excrete salt and other wastes. The result
is that salt and various wastes are stored by the blood in tissues throughout the body. This produces
tissue swellings, edema, and high blood pressure. Blood and protein are also in the urine in excessive
amounts.
Gradually the blood itself becomes contaminated with these waste produces, and uremia (uremic
poisoning) is the result.
Consuming alcohol, tea, coffee, and spices are excellent ways to ruin your kidneys. Do not use
aluminum cooking ware.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Tazama daktari wako.
• Chukua enema ya juu na umwagaji wa kila siku wa nusu ya moto. Toa vikombe 2-3 vya chai ya pleurisy au
chai ya sage wakati kwenye tub. Maliza na bafu fupi baridi au kitambaa baridi. Usimruhusu
baridi. Mfunge vizuri, umweke kitandani, na umpe chai zaidi au chai ya sage
Kuhimiza Jasho. Fomentations juu ya nyuma ya chini na urefu wote wa
mgongo utasaidia kupunguza maumivu. Fanya hivi pia juu ya tumbo, ini, na wengu.
• Kwa tiba zingine za asili ambazo zinaweza kusaidia kudhibiti maambukizi ya njia ya mkojo, angalia chini ya
"Nephritis" na "cystitis."
Dalili -Fever, baridi, uharaka na frequency ya kukojoa, kupoteza hamu ya kula, kichefuchefu, na
kutapika. Mkojo ni mawingu kutoka kwa pus, na mara nyingi umwagaji damu. Ma maumivu yanaweza kuwa makali na ghafla katika chini
Nyuma, juu tu ya kiuno, na kukimbia chini ya gongo. Kiwango kikubwa cha protini ya damu katika
Mkojo ni dalili ya ugonjwa wa Bright. Kawaida hufuatana na shinikizo la damu na edema,
ambayo ni kutunza maji kwenye tishu.
Sababu - Ugonjwa wa Bright unajumuisha uchochezi sugu wa figo (nephritis; ambayo huona), lakini hiyo
ni ya kipekee katika heshima ifuatayo: figo haziwezi kutoa chumvi vizuri na taka zingine. Matokeo
ni kwamba chumvi na taka mbali mbali huhifadhiwa na damu kwenye tishu kwenye mwili wote. Hii inazalisha
Uvimbe wa tishu, edema, na shinikizo la damu. Damu na protini pia ziko kwenye mkojo kwa kupita kiasi
viwango.
Hatua kwa hatua damu yenyewe inachafuliwa na taka hizi huzaa, na uremia (uremic
sumu) ni matokeo.
Kutumia pombe, chai, kahawa, na viungo ni njia bora za kuharibu figo zako. Usitumie
Aluminium kupikia ware.

title: Edema
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• If edema is caused by heart disease, then turn to that section. If it is caused by kidney
failure or other causes, then read the following.
• If it is the result of protein or thiamine deficiency, the intake of either or both should be
increased. Fluid can be retained in the belly cavity because the protein content of the
blood is so low that fluid cannot be kept in the blood vessels.
• If excess salt in the diet is the problem, then a very restricted salt diet should be adhered
to. (Too much salt retained by the body requires additional water to keep the salt diluted,
so it will not damage living tissue.)
• Carry out a regular daily exercise program, out-of-doors. Poor circulation because of
liver or heart disease is a common cause of edema. When at rest, elevate the legs. Avoid
tight clothing, and do not cross the legs. Take hot baths twice a week. Avoid stress. Stop
eating meat. Eat more fruits and vegetables, emphasizing the raw foods.
• Avoid processed and junk foods.
• Increasing the vitamin B intake will reduce the amount of fluid retention.
6
• Take the pulse test, to determine certain foods which do not agree with you. Then avoid
those foods.
• A 1-3 day juice fast will be helpful. But if a protein deficiency is the problem, then
nutrition is needed, not cleansing.
• Helpful herbs include corn silk, dandelion, Scotch broom, alfalfa, Canadian fleabane,
garlic, English hawthorn, juniper berries, lily of the valley, parsley, nettle, marshmallow,
pau d'arco, and prickly restharrow.
(Dropsy)
SYMPTOMS—Swelling of the hands, ankles, feet, face, abdomen, or other areas of the body. Swelling
is most often seen in the hands, in the feet, or around the eyes. The bloating or swelling causes muscle
aches and pains.
CAUSES—Edema is a fluid accumulation in the body. It can be caused by poor kidney function,
chronic kidney disease, congestive heart disease, varicose veins, phlebitis, protein or thiamine
deficiency, sodium retention, or cancer.
Other causal factors include pregnancy, standing for long periods of time; premenstrual tension; the use
of oral contraceptives; a confining injury, such as a sprain, allergic reactions, or a bee sting.
When the skin indents, forming little pits, when the skin of the feet or ankles is pressed by a finger, the
situation is worsening. Contact a physician.
Fluid retention is sometimes caused by a food allergy. Hypothyroidism, anemia, adrenal malfunction,
constipation, and lack of exercise can be causal factors, along with deficiencies of potassium, vitamin B
complex, or vitamins B , B , or B .
1 3 6
As soon as edema is found to exist, it is well to obtain a clear diagnosis. Once congestive heart disease,
kidney disease, or liver disease are ruled out, more subtle causes can be dealt with more easily.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Ikiwa edema inasababishwa na ugonjwa wa moyo, basi geuka kwenye sehemu hiyo. Ikiwa inasababishwa na figo
Kukosa au sababu zingine, kisha soma yafuatayo.
• Ikiwa ni matokeo ya upungufu wa protini au thiamine, ulaji wa ama au wote unapaswa kuwa
kuongezeka. Maji yanaweza kuhifadhiwa kwenye tumbo la tumbo kwa sababu yaliyomo kwenye protini ya
Damu ni ya chini sana kwamba maji hayawezi kuwekwa kwenye mishipa ya damu.
• Ikiwa chumvi zaidi katika lishe ndio shida, basi lishe ya chumvi iliyozuiliwa inapaswa kuzingatiwa
kwa. (Chumvi nyingi iliyohifadhiwa na mwili inahitaji maji ya ziada kuweka chumvi iliyoongezwa,
Kwa hivyo haitaharibu tishu hai.)
• Fanya programu ya mazoezi ya kila siku ya kila siku, nje ya milango. Mzunguko duni kwa sababu ya
Ugonjwa wa ini au moyo ni sababu ya kawaida ya edema. Unapokuwa kupumzika, kuinua miguu. Epuka
Mavazi ya kukausha, na usivuke miguu. Chukua bafu moto mara mbili kwa wiki. Epuka mafadhaiko. Acha
kula nyama. Kula matunda na mboga zaidi, ukisisitiza vyakula mbichi.
• Epuka vyakula vya kusindika na visivyo.
• Kuongeza ulaji wa vitamini B kutapunguza kiwango cha utunzaji wa maji.
6
• Chukua mtihani wa kunde, kuamua vyakula fulani ambavyo havikubaliani na wewe. Kisha epuka
vyakula hivyo.
• Juisi ya siku 1-3 itasaidia. Lakini ikiwa upungufu wa protini ndio shida, basi
Lishe inahitajika, sio utakaso.
• Mimea inayosaidia ni pamoja na hariri ya mahindi, dandelion, ufagio wa Scotch, alfalfa, fleabane ya Canada,
Vitunguu, Hawthorn ya Kiingereza, Berries ya Juniper, Lily ya Bonde, Parsley, Nettle, Marshmallow,
Pau d'Arco, na prickly restharrow.
(Kushuka)
Dalili -Kupanda kwa mikono, vifundoni, miguu, uso, tumbo, au maeneo mengine ya mwili. Uvimbe
Mara nyingi huonekana mikononi, kwa miguu, au karibu na macho. Bloating au uvimbe husababisha misuli
maumivu na maumivu.
Sababu -Dema ni mkusanyiko wa maji mwilini. Inaweza kusababishwa na kazi duni ya figo,
Ugonjwa sugu wa figo, ugonjwa wa moyo, mishipa ya varicose, phlebitis, protini au thiamine
Upungufu, uhifadhi wa sodiamu, au saratani.
Sababu zingine za sababu ni pamoja na ujauzito, kusimama kwa muda mrefu; mvutano wa premenstrual; matumizi
ya uzazi wa mpango wa mdomo; Kuumia kwa siri, kama vile sprain, athari za mzio, au kuumwa kwa nyuki.
Wakati ngozi inapoa, kutengeneza mashimo kidogo, wakati ngozi ya miguu au vifundoni inasisitizwa na kidole,
Hali inazidi kuwa mbaya. Wasiliana na daktari.
Uhifadhi wa maji wakati mwingine husababishwa na mzio wa chakula. Hypothyroidism, anemia, shida ya adrenal,
Kuvimbiwa, na ukosefu wa mazoezi inaweza kuwa sababu za sababu, pamoja na upungufu wa potasiamu, vitamini B
ngumu, au vitamini B, B, au b.
1 3 6
Mara tu edema itakapopatikana, ni vizuri kupata utambuzi wazi. Mara moja ugonjwa wa moyo wenye nguvu,
Ugonjwa wa figo, au ugonjwa wa ini huamuliwa, sababu za hila zaidi zinaweza kushughulikiwa kwa urahisi zaidi.

title: Postnasal Drip
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Blow your nose regularly, but do it very gently.
• Flush your nose with saltwater and gargle with it. Place a half teaspoon of salt in about 8
ounces of warm water (the experts recommend only a third of a teaspoon, if you have high
blood pressure). Draw the water into an aspirator and put the tip into your nose. Then hold
your head back, so you are looking up—and gently squeeze on the aspirator as you
carefully suck it into your nostrils.
• Although this may, at first, seem uncomfortable, it can bring you a lot of relief.
Conclude by blowing your nose gently, to get all the fluid out. Do this 3 times a day for 5
days.
• Next, gargle with the same ratio of salt in the water.
• Reduce the amount of stress you are under, stop drinking milk, but do drink lots of water
or nourishing fluids. An herb tea with some lemon and honey is helpful.
• A humidifier in the room can keep the air moist.
• Avoid nasal decongestants, nose drops, etc. In the long run, they will cause you more
trouble than they are worth.
SYMPTOMS—The back of the mouth drips fluid and runs down into the respiratory tract, starting a
coughing attack, or into the voice box.
CAUSES—Most people only experience postnasal drip when they are sick with a bad cold or something
similar. But some have it when they are well. This article is for them. (See Common Cold and similar
articles in that section.)
Normally, these secretions, from the sinuses, flow down the back of the nose and throat and are swept
away by cilia, which are small waving hairlike projections.
But sometimes the mucous dries out and the cilia no longer wiggle. Then the secretions pool in the back
of the nose, thicken, and then begin dripping into the bronchial tubes or into the voice box.
Here are several suggestions, one or more of which may solve the problem for you at such times:
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Piga pua yako mara kwa mara, lakini ifanye kwa upole sana.
• Futa pua yako na maji ya chumvi na unganishe nayo. Weka kijiko cha chumvi nusu katika kama 8
ounces ya maji ya joto (wataalam wanapendekeza theluthi moja tu ya kijiko, ikiwa unayo juu
shinikizo la damu). Chora maji ndani ya anayetaka na uweke ncha ndani ya pua yako. Kisha shikilia
Kichwa chako nyuma, kwa hivyo unatafuta juu -na upole kwa upole juu ya mtangazaji kama wewe
Inyooshe kwa uangalifu ndani ya pua zako.
• Ingawa hii inaweza, mwanzoni, inaonekana kuwa haifai, inaweza kukuletea utulivu mwingi.
Kuhitimisha kwa kupiga pua yako kwa upole, kupata maji yote nje. Fanya hii mara 3 kwa siku kwa 5
siku.
• Ifuatayo, panda na uwiano sawa wa chumvi kwenye maji.
• Punguza kiwango cha mafadhaiko uliyonayo chini, acha kunywa maziwa, lakini kunywa maji mengi
au maji yenye lishe. Chai ya mimea na limao na asali husaidia.
• Kinyozi ndani ya chumba kinaweza kuweka hewa unyevu.
• Epuka decongestants za pua, matone ya pua, nk kwa muda mrefu, watakusababisha zaidi
Shida kuliko wanavyofaa.
Dalili -Nyuma ya kinywa huchoma maji na hukimbilia kwenye njia ya kupumua, kuanza
shambulio la kukohoa, au ndani ya sanduku la sauti.
Sababu - watu wengi hupata tu matone ya baada ya kuzaa wakati wanaugua na homa mbaya au kitu
sawa. Lakini wengine wanayo wakati wako vizuri. Nakala hii ni kwao. (Tazama baridi ya kawaida na sawa
Nakala katika sehemu hiyo.)
Kawaida, siri hizi, kutoka kwa sinuses, hutiririka nyuma ya pua na koo na zimefagiwa
mbali na cilia, ambayo ni makadirio madogo ya kutikisa.
Lakini wakati mwingine mucous hukauka na cilia haibadiliki tena. Kisha dimbwi la siri nyuma
ya pua, unene, na kisha anza kuteleza kwenye zilizopo za bronchial au kwenye sanduku la sauti.
Hapa kuna maoni kadhaa, moja au zaidi ambayo yanaweza kutatua shida kwako kwa nyakati kama hizi:

title: Suffocation
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Immediate action must be taken. Quickly plunge him into cold water or pour cold water
(the colder the better) on him. This simple procedure powerfully affects the breathing
centers, and he may immediately begin taking deep breaths.
• Then begin other resuscitation treatments while someone calls for emergency help.
SYMPTOMS—The person is apparently suffocating.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Hatua za haraka lazima zichukuliwe. Haraka tuma ndani ya maji baridi au kumwaga maji baridi
(baridi zaidi) juu yake. Utaratibu huu rahisi huathiri kupumua kwa nguvu
vituo, na anaweza kuanza kuchukua pumzi za kina.
• Halafu anza matibabu mengine ya kufufua wakati mtu anataka msaada wa dharura.
Dalili -mtu anaonekana kuwa wa kutosha.

title: Lung Congestion
contentEn:
(J.H. Kellogg, M.D., Formulas)
ACTIVE CONGESTION—Fomentation to back; Cold Compress to chest with Hot Leg Pack, followed
by Cold Mitten Friction and dry heat to legs; short cold applications to hands and arms, followed by Hot
Packs to arms; Revulsive Douche to legs; Hot Leg Bath with very Cold Compress to the chest and to the
back opposite the chest. Change compress as soon as it is warmed.
PASSIVE CONGESTION OF CHEST—Apply Fomentation over chest for 10 minutes every hour;
during the interval between, apply a Cold Compress, renewing it every 15 minutes, rubbing surface well
at each change. This condition most frequently occurs in fevers. Prevent it by frequent change of his
position. Apply same derivative measures as for active congestion (see just above).
PULMONARY HEMORRHAGE—Ice Pack to chest; remove and rub the chest with dry warm
flannel, 1-2 minutes every 15 minutes; Hot Leg Pack, very Hot Sponging of the upper half of the spine.
Place hands in ice water for 1-2 minutes; maintain skin circulation by dry rubbing. Keep him very quiet.
After hemorrhage ceases, graduated cold treatment to increase resistance and combat the disease causing
the hemorrhage. See "Tuberculosis of the Lung."
—Also see "Pneumonia."

msimamo. Omba hatua sawa za derivative kama kwa msongamano wa kazi (tazama tu hapo juu).
Pulmonary hemorrhage -pakiti ya barafu kwa kifua; Ondoa na kusugua kifua na joto kavu
Flannel, dakika 1-2 kila dakika 15; Pakiti ya mguu moto, moto sana wa nusu ya juu ya mgongo.
Weka mikono katika maji ya barafu kwa dakika 1-2; Dumisha mzunguko wa ngozi kwa kusugua kavu. Kumkaa kimya sana.
Baada ya hemorrhage kukomesha, matibabu baridi yalihitimu ili kuongeza upinzani na kupambana na ugonjwa unaosababisha
hemorrhage. Tazama "Kifua kikuu cha mapafu."

title: Emphysema
contentEn:
SYMPTOMS—It is only with great effort that the person can exhale air from his lungs. There is
continual breathlessness. Most any exertion brings coughing. It is hard to breathe in, but worse to
breathe out. The neck veins often stand out from the effort, and he breathes through the mouth in order
to try to get enough air in and out. Breathing is usually rapid and short. He may breathe 25-30 times a
minute, and still not get enough air.
Eventually his chest becomes barrel-shaped, his face ruddy, and he speaks with short, broken phrases.
CAUSES—The word, "emphysema," comes from a Greek word meaning "to puff up with air." The
walls of the lungs lose their elasticity, so air cannot be easily pushed in and out, as should normally
happen. So there is air in the lungs, but it is not moving in and out. As emphysema progresses and there
is more obstruction to airflow, the lungs enlarge with trapped air.
The most frequent cause is smoking, but air pollution also receives some of the blame. Live in the
country and do not have tobacco in your home, and you should be able to avoid this problem.
Emphysema has become the most common modern lung infection in the Western world. Needing a
continual exchange of air to survive, we use about a thousand cubic feet of air each day. It passes over
lung surfaces which, if laid flat, would be as large as a tennis court. In emphysema, a large portion of the
alveoli (the grape-like sacs where the air exchange occurs) are destroyed, and the blood is not properly
aerated.
TREATMENT: LIVING WITH THE PROBLEM—
• The person absolutely must stop smoking. Tobacco smoke should be banished from the
home, car, and place of work. Also avoid hair spray and other sprays.
• Avoid allergens that you know of.
• Maintain a program of regular exercise. Walking out-of-doors is always the best. Try
using 1- or 2-pound hand weights and work the muscles in the neck, upper shoulders, and
chest. Those with chronic emphysema need strong muscles there more than others do.
• Eat less and a little more often. Prolonged digestion requires more oxygen and blood to
the stomach, and away from other parts of the body which also need them.
• Avoid gas-forming foods, such as legumes and cabbage. These cause abdominal
distention which can interfere with breathing.
• Sip warm, clear liquids in the morning (such as herb teas), to help clear mucous from the
airways.
• Excessively hot or cold foods may induce coughing.
• Avoid hard-to-chew foods and maintain a low- salt diet.
• Do not eat when emotionally upset or angry.
• Drink enough water. The fluid intake is needed to keep the mucous, in the lungs, thin.
• Maintain your ideal body weight. Some of those with this problem tend to put on weight
and retain fluid. The closer you are to your ideal weight, the better for your lungs. Stay on
a low-calorie diet. The thinner you are, the less flesh your lungs have to supply oxygen to.
• Obesity and constipation decrease the patient's resistance to respiratory infection.
• Keep your clothing loose; this helps you breathe better.
• Learn to breathe correctly. The tendency is to breathe short and fast. But make yourself
breathe steadily, from the diaphragm. Strengthen your respiration muscles by blowing out
slowly through pursed lips for 30 minutes a day. Try to exhale twice as long as it took you
to breathe in.
• Learn to cough properly. Inhale slowly and deeply, exhale through pursed lips, and
cough in short huffing bursts rather than vigorously.
• Pace yourself in your work. Work steadily; it is not necessary to work fast.
• When working, lift while you exhale through pursed lips; inhale while you rest. When
climbing steps, climb while exhaling; inhale when you stop to rest.
• Go through the day relaxed, not with a sense of alarm over your air problems.
• Avoid contact with anyone with a respiratory infection.
• Avoid drugs which suppress coughs. They dry up secretions, which you do not want.
• Use only essential and unscented soaps. Avoid perfumes, gas stoves, carpeting, curtains
and draperies which cannot easily be cleaned. Avoid hot, humid climates. Avoid furry,
feathered animals in your home.
• Get plenty of fresh air. Use a warm scarf or mask over the mouth and nose when
outdoors in cold weather. Keep the body warm at all times.
• Place 3, 4, or 5-inch blocks under the foot of the bed. This will help prevent mucous
from accumulating in the lower part of the lungs during the night. (But not too steep, for
that would be hard on the heart.)
TREATMENT: SOLVING THE PROBLEM—
The suggestions above are typical of what you will find in most books. It is difficult to find remedial
solutions, but here is one:
Several years ago, a Christian mother visited her neighbors, and met a woman with emphysema. It was a
small, stuffy house and the lady smoked. So the mother went back home and eventually found a
treatment; it was a wet heating pack from Kneipp's book, written nearly two centuries ago. She gave the
treatment to the woman, who got well within several weeks. This was the treatment:
• Place a plastic sheet on the bed, both above the bottom sheet and beneath the top sheet
and covers. Dip another sheet in very cold water, and wring it out somewhat—quickly, to
keep in the cold.
• Work quickly: Wrap the sheet about the person, who is standing unclothed. The sheet
covers everything but the head and perhaps part of the neck. Than wrap a dry blanket
around him. The person immediately gets into the bed, and is covered well with the top
sheet and blankets. This is essentially something like a heating pack, but done only with a
wet sheet. The effect is immediate freezing cold, which the body gradually warms. The
person can remain like this all night.
In the years that followed, the mother mentioned the incident to a number of medical people and doctors,
who were astounded; for everyone says there is no cure for emphysema.
contentSw:
Dalili -ni kwa juhudi kubwa tu kwamba mtu huyo anaweza kuzima hewa kutoka kwa mapafu yake. Kuna
Kupumua kwa kila wakati. Exertion yoyote huleta kukohoa. Ni ngumu kupumua, lakini mbaya zaidi
Pumua nje. Mishipa ya shingo mara nyingi husimama kutoka kwa juhudi, na yeye hupumua kupitia mdomo kwa utaratibu
kujaribu kupata hewa ya kutosha ndani na nje. Kupumua kawaida ni haraka na fupi. Anaweza kupumua mara 25-30 a
Dakika, na bado sio kupata hewa ya kutosha.
Mwishowe kifua chake kinakuwa na umbo la pipa, uso wake ukigonga, na anaongea na maneno mafupi, yaliyovunjika.
Sababu - neno, "emphysema," linatoka kwa neno la Kiyunani linalomaanisha "kujisukuma na hewa."
Kuta za mapafu hupoteza elasticity yao, kwa hivyo hewa haiwezi kusukuma kwa urahisi ndani na nje, kama kawaida inapaswa
kutokea. Kwa hivyo kuna hewa kwenye mapafu, lakini sio kusonga ndani na nje. Kadiri emphysema inavyoendelea na huko
ni kizuizi zaidi kwa hewa ya hewa, mapafu hupanuka na hewa iliyokatwa.
Sababu ya mara kwa mara ni sigara, lakini uchafuzi wa hewa pia hupokea lawama. Kuishi katika
nchi na hawana tumbaku nyumbani kwako, na unapaswa kuwa na uwezo wa kuzuia shida hii.
Emphysema imekuwa maambukizi ya kawaida ya mapafu ya kisasa katika ulimwengu wa magharibi. Kuhitaji a
Kubadilishana kwa hewa kwa kuishi, tunatumia karibu mita za ujazo elfu kila siku. Hupita
Nyuso za mapafu ambazo, ikiwa zimewekwa gorofa, zinaweza kuwa kubwa kama korti ya tenisi. Katika emphysema, sehemu kubwa ya
alveoli (sacs-kama zabibu ambapo ubadilishanaji wa hewa hufanyika) huharibiwa, na damu haiko vizuri
aerated.
Matibabu: Kuishi na shida-
• Mtu lazima kabisa aache kuvuta sigara. Moshi wa tumbaku unapaswa kufutwa kutoka
Nyumbani, gari, na mahali pa kazi. Pia epuka kunyunyizia nywele na vijiko vingine.
• Epuka mzio ambao unajua.
• Kudumisha mpango wa mazoezi ya kawaida. Kutembea nje ya milango daima ni bora. Jaribu
Kutumia uzani wa mkono wa 1- au 2 na fanya misuli kwenye shingo, mabega ya juu, na
kifua. Wale walio na ugonjwa sugu wa muda mrefu wanahitaji misuli yenye nguvu huko zaidi kuliko wengine.
• Kula kidogo na mara nyingi zaidi. Digestion ya muda mrefu inahitaji oksijeni zaidi na damu kwa
Tumbo, na mbali na sehemu zingine za mwili ambazo pia zinahitaji.
Epuka vyakula vinavyounda gesi, kama vile kunde na kabichi. Hizi husababisha tumbo
Kujitenga ambayo inaweza kuingilia kupumua.
• sip joto, vinywaji wazi asubuhi (kama chai ya mimea), kusaidia kusafisha mucous kutoka kwa
Airways.
• Vyakula vyenye moto sana au baridi vinaweza kusababisha kukohoa.
• Epuka vyakula vyenye bidii na kudumisha lishe ya chumvi ya chini.
• Usile wakati wa kihemko au hasira.
• Kunywa maji ya kutosha. Ulaji wa maji unahitajika ili kuweka mucous, kwenye mapafu, nyembamba.
• Kudumisha uzito wako bora wa mwili. Baadhi ya wale walio na shida hii huwa na uzito
na uhifadhi maji. Ukiwa karibu na uzito wako bora, bora kwa mapafu yako. Kaa
lishe ya kalori ya chini. Uwe nyembamba, mwili wako chini ya mapafu yako yanapaswa kusambaza oksijeni.
• Kunenepa na kuvimbiwa kunapunguza upinzani wa mgonjwa kwa maambukizo ya kupumua.
• Weka mavazi yako huru; Hii inakusaidia kupumua vizuri.
• Jifunze kupumua kwa usahihi. Tabia ni kupumua fupi na haraka. Lakini jitengenezee
Pumua kwa kasi, kutoka kwa diaphragm. Kuimarisha misuli yako ya kupumua kwa kulipua
Polepole kupitia midomo iliyofuatwa kwa dakika 30 kwa siku. Jaribu kuzidisha mara mbili kwa muda mrefu kama ilikuchukua
kupumua ndani.
• Jifunze kukohoa vizuri. Inhale polepole na kwa undani, exhale kupitia midomo iliyofuatwa, na
Kikohozi kwa kupunguka kwa muda mfupi badala ya nguvu.
• Panga mwenyewe katika kazi yako. Fanya kazi kwa kasi; Sio lazima kufanya kazi haraka.
• Wakati wa kufanya kazi, kuinua wakati unazidi kupitia midomo iliyofuatwa; Inhale wakati unapumzika. Wakati
hatua za kupanda, kupanda wakati wa kupumua; Inhale unapoacha kupumzika.
• Pitia siku iliyorejeshwa, sio na hisia za kengele juu ya shida zako za hewa.
• Epuka kuwasiliana na mtu yeyote aliye na maambukizo ya kupumua.
• Epuka dawa ambazo hukandamiza kikohozi. Wao hukausha siri, ambazo hutaki.
• Tumia sabuni muhimu tu na ambazo hazina msingi. Epuka manukato, majiko ya gesi, usafirishaji, mapazia
na draperies ambazo haziwezi kusafishwa kwa urahisi. Epuka hali ya hewa ya moto, yenye unyevu. Epuka manyoya,
Wanyama wenye rangi nyumbani kwako.
• Pata hewa nyingi safi. Tumia kitambaa cha joto au mask juu ya mdomo na pua wakati
nje katika hali ya hewa ya baridi. Weka mwili joto wakati wote.
• Weka vitalu 3, 4, au 5-inchi chini ya mguu wa kitanda. Hii itasaidia kuzuia mucous
kutoka kwa kujilimbikiza katika sehemu ya chini ya mapafu wakati wa usiku. (Lakini sio mwinuko sana, kwa
Hiyo itakuwa ngumu moyoni.)
Matibabu: Kutatua Tatizo—
Mapendekezo hapo juu ni mfano wa yale utakayopata katika vitabu vingi. Ni ngumu kupata marekebisho
Suluhisho, lakini hapa kuna moja:
Miaka kadhaa iliyopita, mama Mkristo alitembelea majirani zake, na alikutana na mwanamke aliye na emphysema. Ilikuwa
Nyumba ndogo, yenye vitu na yule mwanamke aliyevuta sigara. Kwa hivyo mama alirudi nyumbani na mwishowe akapata a
matibabu; Ilikuwa pakiti ya kupokanzwa mvua kutoka kwa kitabu cha Kneipp, kilichoandikwa karibu karne mbili zilizopita. Alitoa
Matibabu kwa mwanamke, ambaye alipata vizuri ndani ya wiki kadhaa. Hii ilikuwa matibabu:
• Weka karatasi ya plastiki kwenye kitanda, juu ya karatasi ya chini na chini ya karatasi ya juu
na inashughulikia. Ingiza karatasi nyingine kwenye maji baridi sana, na kuifuta kwa kiasi fulani, kwa haraka, kwa
Weka kwenye baridi.
• Fanya kazi haraka: Funga karatasi juu ya mtu huyo, ambaye amesimama bila nguo. Karatasi
Inashughulikia kila kitu isipokuwa kichwa na labda sehemu ya shingo. Kuliko funga blanketi kavu
karibu naye. Mtu huyo huingia kitandani mara moja, na hufunikwa vizuri na juu
karatasi na blanketi. Kwa kweli hii ni kitu kama pakiti ya kupokanzwa, lakini inafanywa tu na
Karatasi ya mvua. Athari ni baridi ya kufungia mara moja, ambayo mwili hu joto polepole.
Mtu anaweza kubaki kama hii usiku kucha.
Katika miaka iliyofuata, mama huyo alitaja tukio hilo kwa watu kadhaa wa matibabu na madaktari,
ambao walishangaa; Kwa kila mtu anasema hakuna tiba ya emphysema.

title: Legionnaire'S Disease
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Essentially follow the regime listed under "Pneumonia" and "Bronchitis." See your
health care provider. The present rate is that 80% of those contracting the disease die, so
this disease is a very serious matter. Immunosuppressed patients (such as chemotherapy-
treated cancer patients), transplant patients, and AIDS patients are the most susceptible in
contracting it.
SYMPTOMS—It initially appears to be the flu. There is headache, fatigue, achiness, and moderate
fever. But then it develops into what seems more like pneumonia: a high fever (105o F.) with coughing,
diarrhea, chills, disorientation, slow heart rate, dry cough, infection of the pleura, vomiting, severe chest
pain, and shortness of breath. From lack of oxygen, the skin becomes bluish and sputum that is coughed
up, eventually, is gray or blood-streaked.
CAUSES—This is the strange disease which was first identified at the American Legion convention in
1976, which affected 182 partying in a hotel.
Those who smoke, drink, have diabetes, emphysema, or kidney problems are more likely to contract the
disease. Younger people quickly recover, but the elderly can die from respiratory failure.
The Legionella pneumophila bacteria can be in heating and cooling systems. That is how the
Legionnaires got it in that hotel. The disease is not directly transmitted from person to person, but
through cool water droplets.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Kwa kweli fuata serikali iliyoorodheshwa chini ya "pneumonia" na "bronchitis." Tazama yako
mtoa huduma za matibabu. Kiwango cha sasa ni kwamba 80% ya wale wanaougua ugonjwa hufa, kwa hivyo
Ugonjwa huu ni jambo kubwa sana. Wagonjwa walio na kinga (kama chemotherapy-
Wagonjwa wa saratani waliotibiwa), wagonjwa wanaopandikiza, na wagonjwa wa UKIMWI ndio wanaohusika zaidi katika
kuambukizwa.
Dalili -awali inaonekana kuwa homa. Kuna maumivu ya kichwa, uchovu, uchungu, na wastani
homa. Lakini basi inakua katika kile kinachoonekana kama pneumonia: homa kubwa (105o F.) na kukohoa,
kuhara, baridi, kufadhaika, kiwango cha moyo polepole, kikohozi kavu, maambukizi ya pleura, kutapika, kifua kali
maumivu, na upungufu wa pumzi. Kutoka kwa ukosefu wa oksijeni, ngozi inakuwa ya hudhurungi na sputum ambayo imekohoa
Juu, mwishowe, ni kijivu au damu-iliyokatwa.
Sababu - hii ni ugonjwa wa kushangaza ambao ulitambuliwa kwanza kwenye Mkutano wa Jeshi la Amerika katika
1976, ambayo iliathiri 182 kuandamana katika hoteli.
Wale ambao wanavuta sigara, kunywa, wana ugonjwa wa sukari, emphysema, au shida za figo wana uwezekano mkubwa wa kuambukizwa
ugonjwa. Vijana hupona haraka, lakini wazee wanaweza kufa kutokana na kutofaulu kwa kupumua.
Bakteria ya Legionella pneumophila inaweza kuwa katika mifumo ya joto na baridi. Ndivyo jinsi
Legionnaires aliipata katika hoteli hiyo. Ugonjwa haujapitishwa moja kwa moja kutoka kwa mtu hadi mtu, lakini
Kupitia matone ya maji baridi.

title: Q Fever
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• See your physician. Give this problem the care you would give to typhus (which see),
bronchitis, and pneumonia (all three of which see).
SYMPTOMS—Some of the symptoms are like those of typhus (which see), and some are like those of
broncho-pneumonia (see Pneumonia, Bronchitis). There is a sudden onset of fever, headache, weakness,
and a pneumonia-like infection.
CAUSES—Q fever is quite rare in the Western world. It is caused by a rickettsial organism (Coxiella
burnetii) and is worldwide in its coverage. First discovered in Australia, it is now known to even occur
in the United States.
It is endemic in domestic animals. Sheep, goats, and cattle are the primary reservoirs for transference to
humans. The disease is spread to humans by bites from an infected tick (Dermacentor andersoni) and
from drinking raw milk.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Tazama daktari wako. Toa shida hii utunzaji ambao ungempa typhus (ambayo tazama),
bronchitis, na pneumonia (zote tatu ambazo zinaona).
Dalili -zingine za dalili ni kama zile za typhus (ambazo zinaona), na zingine ni kama zile za
Broncho-pneumonia (tazama pneumonia, bronchitis). Kuna mwanzo wa homa, maumivu ya kichwa, udhaifu,
na maambukizi kama ya pneumonia.
Sababu -q homa ni nadra sana katika ulimwengu wa magharibi. Inasababishwa na kiumbe cha riketi (Coxiella
Burnetii) na iko ulimwenguni kote katika chanjo yake. Kugunduliwa kwanza huko Australia, sasa inajulikana hata kutokea
huko Merika.
Ni ugonjwa katika wanyama wa nyumbani. Kondoo, mbuzi, na ng'ombe ndio hifadhi ya msingi ya kuhamisha
wanadamu. Ugonjwa huo unaenea kwa wanadamu kwa kuumwa kutoka kwa tick iliyoambukizwa (Dermacentor Andersoni) na
kutoka kunywa maziwa mabichi.

title: Atherosclerosis
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Eat high fiber foods that are low in fat and cholesterol. Primarily eat fruits, vegetables,
and grains. Dark green leafy vegetables are important. Wheat bran, and other particulate,
fibers are not as effective as those in fruits, vegetables, and legumes.
• Eat foods rich in vitamin E. This includes nuts, seeds, and whole grains.
• Only use cold-pressed vegetable oils (soy, corn, wheat germ, flaxseed). Never heat these
oils; place them on your food at the table.
• Avoid refined sugar. It has been shown to increase serum cholesterol levels, leading to
atherosclerosis.
• Do not eat animal protein; there is a definite connection between eating it and
cardiovascular disease.
• Do not eat processed, junk, dairy, white flour, spiced, or fried foods. Avoid pies, ice
cream, salt, egg yolks, sugar, coffee, colas, nicotine, and alcohol.
• Garlic eaten with cholesterol foods tends to reduce the likelihood that cholesterol will
clog the arteries.
• If you know you are moving toward artery problems, eat no free oils.
• Eggplant tends to lower cholesterol levels.
• Both peanut oil and coconut oil increase atherosclerosis.
• Drink only distilled water.
• Reduce stress and avoid situations causing it.
• Get regular moderate exercise. Walking every day is the best. Build up slowly, but keep
at it.
• A strict vegetarian diet (without milk and eggs) is a good way to avoid artery problems.
• Research at the University of Wisconsin disclosed that skim milk did not lower blood
cholesterol.
• Overweight people should reduce. Even 20% or more above ideal weight carries a
significantly increased risk of atherosclerosis. What is your ideal weight? Assume 100
pounds for the first five feet; add to this five pounds for each inch over that, for women;
add seven pounds per inch over that, for men.
• Do not smoke or use nicotine in any other form. Avoid second-hand smoke.
• Do not take shark cartilage. It may inhibit production of new blood vessels needed to
increase blood circulation.
• Eliminate all environmental sources of metal poisoning, such as aluminum or copper
cooking utensils, copper or lead plumbing, lead-glazed ceramics, contaminated water, etc.
Toxic metals are known to be deposited, among other places, on artery walls.
• X-rays make premature arteriosclerosis more likely.
• Do not eat big evening meals. Best: Only eat plain fruit and plain bread for supper, and
do this several hours before bedtime.
• Chromium (found in brewer's yeast, whole grains, and supplements) added to the diet
lowers cholesterol.
• Keep the extremities warm, to maintain good circulation in them.
• Do not wear constrictive clothing (belts, garters, girdles, tight hosiery, etc.)
• Glucose intolerance can produce a 100% increased risk of atherosclerosis. Keep your
blood sugar levels normal. Do not binge on sweets, etc.
• Avoid constipation, which weakens the liver and kidneys, which in turn sludges the
blood. The Chinese treat stroke by treating constipation.
• Drink enough water!
• Periodically check your blood pressure.
• Too much vitamin D can elevate blood cholesterol.
—Also see "Triglycerides, Lowering"; "Cholesterol, Reducing"; Hypertension"; "Stroke"; and "Cardiac
Problems."
(Plaque Development and Hardening)
SYMPTOMS—Early warning symptoms are intermittent claudication (which see). These are pains in
the legs and possibly feet, which leave upon resting. High blood pressure (see "Hypertension"). The later
result is angina (chest pains) and heart attack.
CAUSES—These are two separate, major diseases, yet we list them together because the problems,
effects, and solutions are so similar.
Arteriosclerosis is hardening of the walls of the arteries; atherosclerosis is the hardening of plaque on the
walls, which causes the walls to harden. (The full explanation is somewhat more complicated.)
Hardened walls produce higher blood pressure, but plaque-hardened and narrow vessels does it also.
The end result of both is a heart attack.
The main difference between the two is that arteriosclerosis is primarily the hardened walls themselves
(which the plaque especially produced). Whereas atherosclerosis is the thickening of that plaque in the
arteries, so that the space for the blood to flow through keeps narrowing. In arteriosclerosis, these
deposits are primarily composed of calcium; in atherosclerosis, the deposits consist of fatty substances,
primarily cholesterol (a blood protein). But, much of the time, an odd assortment of both, along with
lipoproteins, fatty acids, fibrous scar tissue, and blood clump together.
Both conditions have essentially the same effect on circulation, both cause hardening of the artery walls,
both cause high blood pressure, and both eventually lead to one or more of the same things: angina
(which is chest pain following exertion), heart attack (the heart muscle can no longer bear the lack of
blood supply to it), and stroke (when the blood supply to part of the brain is cut off). Death may or may
not follow. The problem is that a clot of this plaque breaks loose, flows through the arteries, and gets
stuck in a narrower artery. If this occurs in the heart muscle, angina and a heart attack may result; if in
the brain, a stroke occurs.
To complicate the matter further, not only can arteriosclerosis and atherosclerosis cause high blood
pressure, but high blood pressure intensifies them both.
Causes include elevated cholesterol or triglyceride levels, eating high cholesterol foods (such as meat,
eggs, whole milk, or milk products).
Other causes include smoking, hypertension (high blood pressure), obesity, diabetes, emotional stress,
lack of exercise, or a family history of the disease. Advancing age increases the risk factor.
Pain in the legs (usually in the calf, but sometimes in the feet or elsewhere in the legs), which increase
when walking but stops as soon as one rests, is intermittent claudication (which see). There may also be
weakness, numbness, and a heavy feeling in the legs. This is a symptom of atherosclerosis in the limbs
(peripheral atherosclerosis). There can also, but less often, be pain in the arms.
There is a home test you can do to help determine if this is beginning to occur: Test the pulse in your
legs and foot. There are three places where this can be done: Apply light pressure on the top of the foot,
the inner hollow of the ankle, and in the hollow behind the knee. If you feel no pulse, then the artery
may be narrowing.
Atherosclerosis is the most common form of arterial disease in the U.S. and most frequently occurs in
the lower limbs. It is the primary cause of death over the age of 65. Over 50% of the people between 65
and 70 will die of some form of this.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Kula vyakula vyenye nyuzi nyingi ambazo ni chini ya mafuta na cholesterol. Kula matunda, mboga mboga,
na nafaka. Mboga ya kijani yenye majani ni muhimu. Branch ya ngano, na chembe zingine,
Nyuzi hazifanyi kazi kama zile za matunda, mboga mboga, na kunde.
• Kula vyakula vyenye vitamini E. Hii ni pamoja na karanga, mbegu, na nafaka nzima.
• Tumia tu mafuta ya mboga iliyoshinikizwa baridi (soya, mahindi, vijidudu vya ngano, flaxseed). Kamwe usiwashe hizi
mafuta; Waweke kwenye chakula chako mezani.
• Epuka sukari iliyosafishwa. Imeonyeshwa kuongeza viwango vya cholesterol ya serum, na kusababisha
atherosclerosis.
• Usila protini ya wanyama; Kuna uhusiano dhahiri kati ya kula na
Ugonjwa wa moyo na mishipa.
• Usila kusindika, taka, maziwa, unga mweupe, vyakula vya kukausha, au vya kukaanga. Epuka mikate, barafu
Cream, chumvi, viini vya yai, sukari, kahawa, colas, nikotini, na pombe.
• Vitunguu huliwa na vyakula vya cholesterol huelekea kupunguza uwezekano ambao cholesterol itafanya
Bonyeza mishipa.
• Ikiwa unajua unaelekea kwenye shida za artery, kula hakuna mafuta ya bure.
• Nyasi huelekea kupunguza viwango vya cholesterol.
• Mafuta yote ya karanga na mafuta ya nazi huongeza atherosclerosis.
• Kunywa tu maji yaliyosafishwa.
Punguza mafadhaiko na epuka hali zinazosababisha.
• Pata mazoezi ya kawaida ya wastani. Kutembea kila siku ni bora zaidi. Jenga polepole, lakini endelea
kwake.
• Lishe kali ya mboga (bila maziwa na mayai) ni njia nzuri ya kuzuia shida za artery.
• Utafiti katika Chuo Kikuu cha Wisconsin ulifichua kuwa maziwa ya skim hayakupunguza damu
Cholesterol.
• Watu wazito wanapaswa kupunguza. Hata 20% au zaidi juu ya uzito bora hubeba a
Kuongezeka kwa hatari ya atherosclerosis. Je! Uzito wako bora ni nini? Fikiria 100
paundi kwa miguu mitano ya kwanza; Ongeza kwa pauni hii tano kwa kila inchi juu ya hiyo, kwa wanawake;
Ongeza pauni saba kwa inchi juu ya hiyo, kwa wanaume.
• Usivute au utumie nikotini katika aina nyingine yoyote. Epuka moshi wa mkono wa pili.
• Usichukue cartilage ya papa. Inaweza kuzuia uzalishaji wa mishipa mpya ya damu inayohitajika
Ongeza mzunguko wa damu.
• Ondoa vyanzo vyote vya mazingira vya sumu ya chuma, kama alumini au shaba
Vyombo vya kupikia, mabomba ya shaba au risasi, kauri zilizo na glasi, maji yaliyochafuliwa, nk.
Metali zenye sumu zinajulikana kuwekwa, kati ya maeneo mengine, kwenye kuta za artery.
• X-rays hufanya arteriosclerosis ya mapema zaidi.
• Usila chakula kubwa cha jioni. Bora: kula tu matunda wazi na mkate wazi kwa chakula cha jioni, na
Fanya hivi masaa kadhaa kabla ya kulala.
• Chromium (inayopatikana katika chachu ya Brewer, nafaka nzima, na virutubisho) iliyoongezwa kwenye lishe
cholesterol ya chini.
• Weka miisho ya joto, ili kudumisha mzunguko mzuri ndani yao.
• Usivae mavazi ya kuvutia (mikanda, garters, vifungo, hosiery kali, nk)
• Uvumilivu wa sukari unaweza kutoa hatari ya kuongezeka kwa atherosulinosis. Weka yako
Viwango vya sukari ya damu kawaida. Usiunge na pipi, nk.
• Epuka kuvimbiwa, ambayo inadhoofisha ini na figo, ambayo kwa upande hupunguza
damu. Wachina hutibu kiharusi kwa kutibu kuvimbiwa.
• Kunywa maji ya kutosha!
• Mara kwa mara angalia shinikizo la damu yako.
• Vitamini D sana inaweza kuinua cholesterol ya damu.
-Unaona "triglycerides, kupungua"; "Cholesterol, Kupunguza"; Shinikizo la damu ";" kiharusi "; na" moyo
Shida. "
(Maendeleo ya Jalada na Ugumu)
Dalili -Dalili za onyo la mapema ni utapeli wa muda mfupi (ambao unaona). Hizi ni maumivu ndani
Miguu na labda miguu, ambayo huacha kupumzika. Shinikizo la damu (angalia "shinikizo la damu"). Baadaye
Matokeo ni angina (maumivu ya kifua) na mshtuko wa moyo.
Sababu - hizi ni magonjwa mawili tofauti, makubwa, lakini tunayaorodhesha pamoja kwa sababu shida,
Athari, na suluhisho ni sawa.
Arteriosclerosis ni ugumu wa kuta za mishipa; Atherosclerosis ni ugumu wa plaque kwenye
kuta, ambayo husababisha kuta ngumu. (Maelezo kamili ni ngumu zaidi.)
Kuta zilizo ngumu hutoa shinikizo kubwa la damu, lakini vyombo vyenye ngumu na nyembamba hufanya hivyo pia.
Matokeo ya mwisho ya wote ni mshtuko wa moyo.
Tofauti kuu kati ya hizo mbili ni kwamba arteriosclerosis kimsingi ni kuta ngumu zenyewe
(ambayo jalada hutolewa hasa). Wakati atherosclerosis ni unene wa jalada hilo katika
mishipa, ili nafasi ya damu kupita kupitia inaendelea kupungua. Katika arteriosclerosis, hizi
Amana ni pamoja na kalsiamu; Katika atherosulinosis, amana zinajumuisha vitu vyenye mafuta,
kimsingi cholesterol (protini ya damu). Lakini, wakati mwingi, urval isiyo ya kawaida ya wote wawili, pamoja na
Lipoproteins, asidi ya mafuta, tishu za nyuzi za nyuzi, na damu pamoja.
Masharti yote mawili yana athari sawa juu ya mzunguko, zote mbili husababisha ugumu wa kuta za artery,
Zote mbili husababisha shinikizo la damu, na mwishowe husababisha moja au zaidi ya vitu sawa: angina
(ambayo ni maumivu ya kifua kufuatia bidii), mshtuko wa moyo (misuli ya moyo haiwezi kubeba tena ukosefu wa
usambazaji wa damu kwake), na kiharusi (wakati usambazaji wa damu hadi sehemu ya ubongo umekatwa). Kifo kinaweza au kinaweza
usifuate. Shida ni kwamba kitambaa cha jalada hili huvunja, hutiririka kupitia mishipa, na hupata
kukwama katika artery nyembamba. Ikiwa hii itatokea katika misuli ya moyo, angina na mshtuko wa moyo unaweza kusababisha; ikiwa ndani
Ubongo, kiharusi hufanyika.
Ili kuzidisha jambo hilo zaidi, sio tu kwamba arteriosclerosis na atherosclerosis inaweza kusababisha damu ya juu
shinikizo, lakini shinikizo la damu linazidisha wote wawili.
Sababu ni pamoja na cholesterol iliyoinuliwa au viwango vya triglyceride, kula vyakula vya cholesterol kubwa (kama nyama,
Mayai, maziwa yote, au bidhaa za maziwa).
Sababu zingine ni pamoja na kuvuta sigara, shinikizo la damu (shinikizo la damu), ugonjwa wa kunona sana, ugonjwa wa sukari, mkazo wa kihemko,
ukosefu wa mazoezi, au historia ya familia ya ugonjwa. Kuendeleza umri huongeza sababu ya hatari.
Maumivu katika miguu (kawaida katika ndama, lakini wakati mwingine katika miguu au mahali pengine kwenye miguu), ambayo huongezeka
Wakati wa kutembea lakini huacha mara tu mtu anakaa, ni ujazo wa muda mfupi (ambao unaona). Kunaweza pia kuwa
Udhaifu, ganzi, na hisia nzito kwenye miguu. Hii ni ishara ya atherosclerosis kwenye miguu
(pembeni ya atherosclerosis). Kunaweza pia, lakini chini ya mara nyingi, kuwa maumivu katika mikono.
Kuna mtihani wa nyumbani unaweza kufanya kusaidia kuamua ikiwa hii inaanza kutokea: jaribu mapigo katika yako
miguu na mguu. Kuna sehemu tatu ambapo hii inaweza kufanywa: tumia shinikizo nyepesi juu ya mguu,
mashimo ya ndani ya kiwiko, na ndani ya shimo nyuma ya goti. Ikiwa unahisi hakuna mapigo, basi artery
inaweza kuwa nyembamba.
Atherosclerosis ndio aina ya kawaida ya ugonjwa wa arterial huko Merika na mara nyingi hufanyika katika
miguu ya chini. Ndio sababu ya msingi ya kifo zaidi ya umri wa miaka 65. Zaidi ya 50% ya watu kati ya 65
na 70 watakufa kwa aina fulani ya hii.

title: Varicose Veins
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Follow the lengthy suggestions given under "Phlebitis and Thrombophlebitis."
SYMPTOMS—Visibly distended veins. There may be aching or tiredness, a feeling of fullness in the
limbs. The skin may have a tense or burning sensation. Muscle cramps may occur, especially at night.
Hemorrhage under the skin may cause the skin to discolor (light brown to bluish). Veins may be
abnormally large, bulging, and lumpy looking.
CAUSES—The valves of the veins no longer function properly. They become stretched from excess
pressure. The deep veins are surrounded by muscles which keep them in shape. But those close to the
surface (saphenous veins) are ones which develop these problems.
Contraceptive medications can induce varicose veins, as well as hormonal vasodilation just prior to
menstruation. They can occur during pregnancy (especially during the first 3 months).
Straining at the stool, because of the lack of dietary fiber, causes constipation and can result in varicose
veins, diverticulosis, hemorrhoids, phlebitis, and hiatus hernia.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Fuata maoni marefu yaliyopewa chini ya "phlebitis na thrombophlebitis."
Dalili -Veins zilizoonekana wazi. Kunaweza kuwa na kuumiza au uchovu, hisia ya utimilifu katika
miguu. Ngozi inaweza kuwa na hisia kali au ya kuchoma. Matumbo ya misuli yanaweza kutokea, haswa usiku.
Hemorrhage chini ya ngozi inaweza kusababisha ngozi discolor (hudhurungi nyepesi). Mishipa inaweza kuwa
Kubwa isiyo ya kawaida, bulging, na lumpy kuangalia.
Sababu - valves za mishipa hazifanyi kazi vizuri tena. Wanakuwa wamenyooka kutoka kwa ziada
shinikizo. Mishipa ya kina imezungukwa na misuli ambayo inawaweka katika sura. Lakini wale walio karibu na
Uso (mishipa ya saphenous) ni zile ambazo huendeleza shida hizi.
Dawa za uzazi wa mpango zinaweza kusababisha mishipa ya varicose, pamoja na vasodilation ya homoni kabla tu
hedhi. Wanaweza kutokea wakati wa ujauzito (haswa wakati wa miezi 3 ya kwanza).
Kuweka kwenye kinyesi, kwa sababu ya ukosefu wa nyuzi za lishe, husababisha kuvimbiwa na inaweza kusababisha varicose
mishipa, diverticulosis, hemorrhoids, phlebitis, na hiatus hernia.

title: Poor Circulation And Chills
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Improvement of a hypothyroidism condition (which see).
• Take 800-1,200 IU of vitamin E daily. Take vitamin C to bowel tolerance. Also needed:
niacin, RNA, and folic acid.
• Purifying the blood stream will help in restoring proper circulation. This would include
enemas or colonics, juice fasting for a day or two, followed by a nourishing diet.
• Do not eat meat; fatty, processed, or junk foods. Do not eat cheese.
• Take cool morning showers or alternating hot and cold showers for 5 minutes morning
and evening. Exercise afterward and make sure you are warm. If you are not warm
afterward, you did not gain.
• Exercise outdoors and practice deep breathing.
• Drink red clover, sassafras, and burdock teas in order to clean the blood.
• Other helpful herbs include ginkgo, hawthorn, lily-of-the-valley, lavender, rosemary,
scotch pine, and cayenne.
—Also see "Chills."
SYMPTOMS—Cold hands and feet, and numb tingling fingers and toes. A general sense of chilliness
when others are warm.
CAUSES—Poor circulation can be caused by cardiovascular disease, low thyroid, and vitamin E
deficiency.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Uboreshaji wa hali ya hypothyroidism (ambayo huona).
• Chukua 800-1,200 IU ya vitamini E kila siku. Chukua vitamini C kwa uvumilivu wa matumbo. Inahitajika pia:
niacin, RNA, na asidi ya folic.
• Kusafisha mkondo wa damu itasaidia katika kurejesha mzunguko sahihi. Hii itajumuisha
Enemas au koloni, kufunga juisi kwa siku moja au mbili, ikifuatiwa na lishe yenye lishe.
• Usila nyama; Mafuta, kusindika, au vyakula vya bure. Usile jibini.
• Chukua maonyesho ya asubuhi ya baridi au kubadilisha moto na baridi kwa dakika 5 asubuhi
na jioni. Zoezi baadaye na hakikisha una joto. Ikiwa hauna joto
Baadaye, haukupata.
• Zoezi nje na mazoezi ya kupumua kwa kina.
• Kunywa clover nyekundu, sassafras, na chai ya burdock ili kusafisha damu.
• Mimea mingine inayosaidia ni pamoja na Ginkgo, Hawthorn, Lily-of-the-Valley, Lavender, Rosemary,
Scotch Pine, na Cayenne.
-Unaona "Chills."
Dalili -pindua mikono na miguu, na vidole vyenye kung'aa na vidole. Maana ya jumla ya kufifia
Wakati wengine ni joto.
Sababu -Mzunguko mkubwa unaweza kusababishwa na ugonjwa wa moyo na mishipa, tezi ya chini, na vitamini E
upungufu.

title: Chlorosis
contentEn:
(Green Sickness, type of anemia) (J.H. Kellogg, M.D.,
Formulas)
Chlorosis is a form of anemia in adolescent girls, generally due to faulty diet during puberty. It is also
called "green sickness."
CORRECT ENTEROPTOSIS—Abdominal supporter; abdominal massage; corrective exercises; Cold
Douche to abdomen.
INCREASE VITAL RESISTANCE—General graduated cold procedures (Tonic Frictions) twice
daily.
COMBAT AUTOINTOXICATION—Aseptic diet; sweating bath (Hot Full Bath) to begin
perspiration, Radiant Heat Bath or sunbath, followed by short cold application.
VASOMOTOR SPASM—General Revulsive Douche; Alternate Full Bath at 1050-1100F., 30 seconds,
and then into one at 800-900 F., for 15 seconds; simultaneous Revulsive Douche.
VISCERAL ANEMIAS—Douches to visceral (trunk) areas; Alternate Douche or Revulsive Douche,
with short percussion for either; Alternate Compress over the afflicted part, followed by a well-protected
Heating Compress; protected (plastic covered) Hot Abdominal Pack at night; Cool Enema at 750-680 F.,
1-3 pints, daily.
—Also see "Anemia—1."
contentSw:
(Ugonjwa wa Kijani, Aina ya Anemia) (J.H. Kellogg, M.D.,
Fomula)
Chlorosis ni aina ya anemia katika wasichana wa ujana, kwa ujumla kutokana na lishe mbaya wakati wa kubalehe. Pia ni
Inaitwa "Ugonjwa wa Kijani."
Enteroptosis sahihi -Msaidizi wa tumbo; Massage ya tumbo; Mazoezi ya marekebisho; Baridi
Douche kwa tumbo.
Ongeza upinzani muhimu -Taratibu za Baridi zilizohitimu (Tonic Frictions) mara mbili
kila siku.
Kupambana na autonioxication -lishe yaseptic; Bafu ya jasho (umwagaji kamili wa moto) kuanza
Mshtuko, umwagaji wa joto mkali au jua, ikifuatiwa na matumizi mafupi ya baridi.
Vasomotor spasm -Jenerali Reversive Douche; Bafu mbadala kamili saa 1050-1100f., Sekunde 30,
na kisha kuwa moja kwa 800-900 F., kwa sekunde 15; wakati huo huo douche.
Anemias ya visceral -inaamua maeneo ya visceral (shina); Douche mbadala au douche inayobadilisha,
na mtazamo mfupi kwa ama; Mbadala wa compress juu ya sehemu iliyoteseka, ikifuatiwa na mtu aliyelindwa vizuri
Inapokanzwa compress; kulindwa (plastiki kufunikwa) pakiti ya tumbo moto usiku; Enema baridi saa 750-680 F.,
Pints ​​1-3, kila siku.
-Unaona "Anemia -1."

title: Pernicious Anemia
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Take 50-100 mcg injections of vitamin B .
12
• Eat a highly nutritious diet, rich in protein, calcium, vitamins C, E, and iron.
• Take supplements of the entire B complex, to aid in B absorption.
12
• (Important exception: Folic acid should not be taken in amounts greater than 0.1 mg
daily.) Folic acid has the effect of concealing the symptoms of pernicious anemia,
permitting the unseen destruction of the nervous system to continue until irreparable
damage has occurred.
• There should be sufficient stomach acid to absorb the minerals. If there is not, take some
lemon juice.
—Also see "Anemia—1."
SYMPTOMS—Weakness, slight yellowing of the skin, tingling of the extremities, and gastrointestinal
disturbances causing a sore tongue. There can be partial loss of coordination of the fingers, feet, and
legs. Some nerve deterioration may occur. Diarrhea and loss of appetite may also be present.
CAUSES—Pernicious anemia is caused by a deficiency of vitamin B . This is a severe form of anemia
12
in which the bone marrow fails to produce mature red blood cells.
The stomach has to be able to produce what is known as "intrinsic factor," in order for vitamin B to be
12
absorbed by the intestines.
Pernicious anemia rarely occurs under the age of 30, but it becomes more common with age.
Without treatment, pernicious anemia may be fatal.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Chukua sindano 50-100 za mcg za vitamini b.
12
• Kula lishe yenye lishe kubwa, yenye protini, kalsiamu, vitamini C, E, na chuma.
• Chukua virutubisho vya tata ya B, kusaidia katika kunyonya kwa B.
12
• (Isipokuwa muhimu: asidi ya folic haipaswi kuchukuliwa kwa kiasi kikubwa kuliko 0.1 mg
kila siku.) Asidi ya folic ina athari ya kuficha dalili za upungufu wa damu,
Kuruhusu uharibifu usioonekana wa mfumo wa neva kuendelea hadi iwezekane
Uharibifu umetokea.
• Lazima kuwe na asidi ya tumbo ya kutosha kuchukua madini. Ikiwa hakuna, chukua
maji ya limao.
-Unaona "Anemia -1."
Dalili -umilele, njano kidogo ya ngozi, kuuma kwa miisho, na utumbo
usumbufu unaosababisha ulimi wenye kidonda. Kunaweza kuwa na upotezaji wa sehemu ya uratibu wa vidole, miguu, na
miguu. Kuzorota kwa ujasiri kunaweza kutokea. Kuhara na upotezaji wa hamu ya kula pia kunaweza kuwapo.
Sababu -Anemia inayosababishwa husababishwa na upungufu wa vitamini B. Hii ni aina kali ya anemia
12
ambayo uboho wa mfupa unashindwa kutoa seli nyekundu za damu.
Tumbo lazima liweze kutoa kile kinachojulikana kama "sababu ya ndani," ili vitamini B iwe
12
kufyonzwa na matumbo.
Anemia mbaya mara chache hufanyika chini ya umri wa miaka 30, lakini inakuwa kawaida zaidi na umri.
Bila matibabu, anemia mbaya inaweza kuwa mbaya.

title: Hemorrhage
contentEn:
SYMPTOMS AND CAUSES—Bleeding in the stool, which indicates stomach ulcers (black blood
stool), ulcerative colitis (bloody mucus in stool), colon cancer (bloody mucus in the stool), and
hemorrhoids (bright red blood).
Coughing blood indicates lung cancer and tuberculosis.
—Also see "Peptic Ulcers," "Colitis," "Cancer," "Hemorrhoids," "Tuberculosis," "Nosebleed," and
"Menstrual Disorders," etc.
contentSw:
Dalili na sababu -kumwagika kwenye kinyesi, ambayo inaonyesha vidonda vya tumbo (damu nyeusi
kinyesi), colitis ya ulcerative (kamasi ya umwagaji damu kwenye kinyesi), saratani ya koloni (kamasi ya damu kwenye kinyesi), na
hemorrhoids (damu nyekundu nyekundu).
Damu ya kukohoa inaonyesha saratani ya mapafu na kifua kikuu.
-Unaona "vidonda vya peptic," "colitis," "saratani," "hemorrhoids," "kifua kikuu," "pua," na
"Shida za hedhi," nk.

title: Hemophilia
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Eat a diet high in vitamin K. Foods rich in K and other essential clotting factors include
alfalfa, broccoli, egg yolks, kale, and all green leafy vegetables. Green drinks are also
good for K and other essential clotting.
• The hemophiliac is given blood transfusions periodically to provide the missing blood
factors.
SYMPTOMS—When a wound occurs, blood does not clot normally.
Early warning signs of internal bleeding include a bubbling or tingling sensation or a feeling of warmth,
tightness, or stiffness in the hemorrhaging area.
Headache, confusion, drowsiness, or a blow to the head may indicate bleeding in the head.
If your hemophiliac child cries for no apparent reason, refuses to walk, use his arm or leg, or seems to
have a swelling or unusual bruising, go to an emergency room.
CAUSES—Hemophilia is hereditary. It primarily affects males and is passed down through females
(who are carriers). Children of carriers have a 50% chance of inheriting the defective gene. If they
inherit it, the boys will be hemophiliacs, and the girls will be carriers. The sons of hemophiliacs will not
give the problem to their sons, but the daughters will always be carriers.
As many as two-thirds of all hemophiliacs, in America, have HIV. They contracted it from contaminated
blood transfusion sources. About 450 babies are born with hemophilia each year.
The blood of hemophiliacs does not clot properly, but minor bleeding is not serious. It is internal
bleeding that can be fatal, if not treated.
Bleeding frequently occurs in the knees, which causes painful swelling. Repeated swelling destroys the
knee cartilage and results in a permanently stiff knee (called hemophiliac arthritis). Other joints can also
be affected. Other body parts, including the brain, can also be affected by internal bleeding.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Kula chakula cha juu katika vitamini K. Vyakula vyenye utajiri katika K na mambo mengine muhimu ya kuficha ni pamoja na
alfalfa, broccoli, viini vya yai, kale, na mboga zote zenye majani mabichi. Vinywaji vya kijani pia ni
Nzuri kwa K na blotting nyingine muhimu.
• Hemophiliac hupewa damu mara kwa mara ili kutoa damu inayokosekana
mambo.
Dalili -Wakati jeraha linapotokea, damu haifungi kawaida.
Ishara za tahadhari za mapema za kutokwa na damu ya ndani ni pamoja na hisia za kupendeza au hisia za joto au hisia ya joto,
Uwezo, au ugumu katika eneo la kutokwa na damu.
Maumivu ya kichwa, machafuko, usingizi, au pigo kwa kichwa inaweza kuonyesha kutokwa na damu kichwani.
Ikiwa mtoto wako wa hemophiliac analia bila sababu dhahiri, anakataa kutembea, kutumia mkono wake au mguu, au anaonekana
Kuwa na uvimbe au michubuko ya kawaida, nenda kwenye chumba cha dharura.
Sababu -hemophilia ni urithi. Inaathiri wanaume na hupitishwa kupitia wanawake
(ambao ni wabebaji). Watoto wa wabebaji wana nafasi ya 50% ya kurithi jeni lenye kasoro. Ikiwa wao
Urithi, wavulana watakuwa hemophiliacs, na wasichana watakuwa wabebaji. Wana wa hemophiliacs hawatafanya
Toa shida kwa wanawe, lakini binti watakuwa wabebaji kila wakati.
Theluthi kama theluthi mbili ya hemophiliacs zote, huko Amerika, zina VVU. Waliipata kutoka kwa uchafu
Vyanzo vya Uhamishaji wa Damu. Karibu watoto 450 huzaliwa na hemophilia kila mwaka.
Damu ya hemophiliacs haitoi vizuri, lakini kutokwa na damu ndogo sio mbaya. Ni ya ndani
Kutokwa na damu ambayo inaweza kuwa mbaya, ikiwa haitatibiwa.
Kutokwa na damu mara nyingi hufanyika katika magoti, ambayo husababisha uvimbe wenye uchungu. Uvimbe unaorudiwa huharibu
Cartilage ya goti na husababisha goti ngumu kabisa (inayoitwa hemophiliac arthritis). Viungo vingine pia vinaweza
kuathiriwa. Sehemu zingine za mwili, pamoja na ubongo, zinaweza pia kuathiriwa na kutokwa na damu ya ndani.

title: Blood Poisoning
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Apply two hot fomentations and then one cold towel over the affected area. Continue
this alternate application until the red lines disappear.
• Apply a poultice of lemons or charcoal. Or crush one or more of the herbs listed later in
this article.
• Take a high enema.
• Drink as many cups of echinacea tea a day as possible.
• Keep the temperature evenly warm, have enough air, and give a little cayenne in water
when he feels chilly.
• Drink charcoal water.
• Wash wound thoroughly with boric solution. If discharge from the wound is thin, apply
powdered 50-50 myrrh and goldenseal directly to the wound.
• Go on a cleansing program of juice fasting for a time, followed by rebuilding on a good,
nourishing diet.
• Drink tea of chickweed, plantain, goldenseal, and myrrh.
(Septicemia)
SYMPTOMS—Swelling, severe localized pain, discoloration, red streaks from the wound up the veins
toward the heart, and sores that do not heal.
CAUSES—Whenever a sore, cut, or abrasion becomes red and infected, it could produce blood
poisoning.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Omba fomentations mbili moto na kisha kitambaa moja baridi juu ya eneo lililoathiriwa. Endelea
Programu mbadala hii hadi mistari nyekundu itakapotoweka.
• Tumia poultice ya lemoni au mkaa. Au kuponda moja au zaidi ya mimea iliyoorodheshwa baadaye
Nakala hii.
• Chukua enema ya juu.
• Kunywa vikombe vingi vya chai ya Echinacea kwa siku iwezekanavyo.
• Weka joto sawasawa joto, uwe na hewa ya kutosha, na upe cayenne kidogo kwenye maji
Wakati anahisi chilly.
• Kunywa maji ya mkaa.
• Osha jeraha kabisa na suluhisho la boroni. Ikiwa kutokwa kutoka kwa jeraha ni nyembamba, tumia
poda 50-50 Myrrh na Goldenseal moja kwa moja kwa jeraha.
• Nenda kwenye mpango wa kusafisha wa juisi kwa muda, ukifuatiwa na kujenga tena nzuri,
lishe yenye lishe.
• Kunywa chai ya vifaranga, mmea, dhahabu, na manemane.
(Septicemia)
Dalili -Kupanda, maumivu makali ya ndani, kubadilika rangi, vijito nyekundu kutoka kwa jeraha la mishipa
kuelekea moyo, na vidonda ambavyo haviponya.
Sababu - wakati wote kidonda, kata, au abrasion huwa nyekundu na kuambukizwa, inaweza kutoa damu
sumu.

title: Vertigo
contentEn:
TREATMENT
• Immediately, sit in a chair with your feet flat on the floor and stare at a fixed object for a
few minutes.
• But, if the cause is low-blood pressure, lower your head while the blood gets up there.
• Eat a nutritious diet, including niacin, B , and the entire B complex—including B , B ,
6 1 2
and pantothenic acid. Vitamin C is also important.
• Do not take over 2,000 mg of total sodium per day. Too much sodium disrupts the
operation of the inner ear.
• Take powdered peppercorns.
• Avoid nicotine, caffeine, alcohol, and fried foods.
• Catnip tea will help.
• If vertigo begins after taking some new drug, stop using it immediately.
• If vertigo seems to be chronic, search out the causes. You may need professional help.
—Also see "Motion Sickness."
(Dizziness)
SYMPTOMS—Dizziness, faintness, or light-headedness. The person may feel that he is falling or
sinking or that the room is moving around him, sometimes even spinning. This sensation is usually
accompanied by nausea, vomiting, perspiration, headache, or hearing loss.
CAUSES—Vertigo is caused by an impaired sense of balance and equilibrium, and is generally due to
an inner ear problem. Older people have it more often than those younger.
If the original cause is concussion, skull fracture, or injuring the inner ear, the dizziness may occur long
after the injury supposedly healed.
Other causes are anemia, brain tumors, high or low blood pressure, psychological stress, lack of oxygen
or glucose in the blood, nutritional deficiencies, viral infection, fever, changes in atmospheric pressure,
the use of certain drugs, middle ear infections, excess wax in the ear, or blockage of the ear canal or
eustachian tube.
Lower oxygen levels at higher altitudes can also cause it. Another cause is vitamin B and niacin
6
deficiency.
You can expect that you may temporarily experience it if you engage in certain activities, such as
amusement park rides, sailing, or virtual reality games.
Be aware that dizziness can be a warning sign of a coming heart attack or stroke. It can also be an
indication that a concussion has just occurred.
Dizziness is not the same as vertigo. From time to time, anyone can experience some dizziness or
faintness. Those with low-blood pressure will frequently experience this when standing up suddenly.
contentSw:
Matibabu
• Mara moja, kaa kwenye kiti na miguu yako gorofa kwenye sakafu na uangalie kitu kilichowekwa kwa
Dakika chache.
• Lakini, ikiwa sababu ni shinikizo la damu ya chini, punguza kichwa chako wakati damu inakua hapo.
• Kula lishe yenye lishe, pamoja na niacin, b, na tata nzima ya b - pamoja na b, b,
6 1 2
na asidi ya pantothenic. Vitamini C pia ni muhimu.
• Usichukue zaidi ya 2,000 mg ya sodiamu jumla kwa siku. Sodiamu nyingi huvuruga
operesheni ya sikio la ndani.
• Chukua pilipili zenye unga.
• Epuka nikotini, kafeini, pombe, na vyakula vya kukaanga.
• Chai ya Catnip itasaidia.
• Ikiwa Vertigo itaanza baada ya kuchukua dawa mpya, acha kuitumia mara moja.
• Ikiwa Vertigo inaonekana kuwa sugu, tafuta sababu. Unaweza kuhitaji msaada wa kitaalam.
-Unaona "Ugonjwa wa Motion."
(Kizunguzungu)
Dalili-unene, kukata tamaa, au kichwa-mwanga. Mtu anaweza kuhisi kuwa anaanguka au
Kuzama au kwamba chumba kinazunguka karibu naye, wakati mwingine hata inazunguka. Hisia hii kawaida
ikifuatana na kichefuchefu, kutapika, jasho, maumivu ya kichwa, au upotezaji wa kusikia.
Sababu -Vertigo husababishwa na hali mbaya ya usawa na usawa, na kwa ujumla ni kwa sababu ya
shida ya sikio la ndani. Wazee wanayo mara nyingi zaidi kuliko wale wadogo.
Ikiwa sababu ya asili ni dhana, kuvunjika kwa fuvu, au kujeruhi sikio la ndani, kizunguzungu kinaweza kutokea kwa muda mrefu
Baada ya jeraha linalodaiwa kupona.
Sababu zingine ni anemia, tumors za ubongo, shinikizo la juu au la chini la damu, mkazo wa kisaikolojia, ukosefu wa oksijeni
au sukari katika damu, upungufu wa lishe, maambukizi ya virusi, homa, mabadiliko katika shinikizo la anga,
Matumizi ya dawa fulani, maambukizo ya sikio la kati, nta ya ziada kwenye sikio, au blockage ya mfereji wa sikio au
Tube ya Eustachian.
Viwango vya chini vya oksijeni katika mwinuko mkubwa pia vinaweza kusababisha. Sababu nyingine ni vitamini B na niacin
6
upungufu.
Unaweza kutarajia kuwa unaweza kuiona kwa muda ikiwa utajihusisha na shughuli fulani, kama vile
Hifadhi ya burudani, meli za kusafiri, au michezo halisi ya ukweli.
Fahamu kuwa kizunguzungu kinaweza kuwa ishara ya onyo la mshtuko wa moyo unaokuja au kiharusi. Inaweza pia kuwa
dalili kwamba dhana imetokea tu.
